required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Laser Therapy and Exercise in Participants With Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Additional Effects The Association Of The Photobiomodulation Therapy (904 Nm) With Exercise In Participants With Chronic Non-Specific Low Back Pain In The Short Term

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal University of the Valleys of Jequitinhonha and Mucuri

clinical_study.source: Federal University of the Valleys of Jequitinhonha and Mucuri

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this clinical trial is to evaluate the additional effects of Laser Therapy in participants with chronic non-specific low back pain in the short term.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this clinical trial is to evaluate the additional effects of Photobiomodulation Therapy in participants with chronic non-specifc low back pain in the short term.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change Of Pain intensity at post-intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Immediately after the last intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). The VAS evaluates pain intensity levels perceived by the patient on an 11-point scale ranging from 0 to 10, with 0 being 'no pain' and 10 'the worst possible pain'.

primary_outcome.measure: Change Of Pain intensity at 3 months post-intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; 3 months after the last intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). The VAS evaluates pain intensity levels perceived by the patient on an 11-point scale ranging from 0 to 10, with 0 being 'no pain' and 10 'the worst possible pain'.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Disability associated with low back pain at post-intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Immediately after the last intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire. The questionnaire consists of 24 items that describe situations that patients may have difficulty performing on a daily basis due to LBP. The greater the number of affirmative answers is, the higher the level of functional disability associated with LBP.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Disability associated with low back pain at 3 months post-intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; 3 months after the last intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire. The questionnaire consists of 24 items that describe situations that patients may have difficulty performing on a daily basis due to LBP. The greater the number of affirmative answers is, the higher the level of functional disability associated with LBP.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Immediately after the last intervention; 3 months after the last intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the reduced version of the Anxiety, Depression and Stress Scale-21. It is a self-report instrument composed of three subscales with seven items each, to assess depression, anxiety and stress in the previous week. The variations in scores correspond to symptom levels, which vary between "normal" and "very severe".

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Disability associated with low back pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Immediately after the last intervention; 3 months after the last intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability Questionnaire. The scale consists of 10 questions with six alternatives, the value of which ranges from 0 to 5. It is classified into: minimum disability (0 - 20%), moderate disability (21- 40%), severe disability (41 - 60%) , a patient who is disabled (61 - 80%), and an individual restricted to bed (81 - 100%).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Mobility of the lumbar and sacral segments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Immediately after the last intervention; 3 months after the last intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified Schober test

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Strength of the trunk extensor muscle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Immediately after the last intervention; 3 months after the last intervention

arm_group.description: Exercise protocol: The program will consist of individual sessions of progressive and submaximal exercises with aerobic training on a treadmill and spine strengthening exercise. Photobiomodulation therapy: will be performed using the active super pulsed laser (904nm).

Exercise protocol: The program will consist of individual sessions of progressive and submaximal exercises with aerobic training on a treadmill and spine strengthening exercise. Photobiomodulation therapy: will be performed using the placebo super pulsed laser (904nm).

intervention.description: Treatment sessions will be provided twice a week for 6 weeks (totaling 12 sessions) with participants receiving either placebo or active PBMT + exercise protocol.

overall_official.affiliation: Federal University of the Valleys of Jequitinhonha and Mucuri
